characters: ACROSS THE WAY- DIRTY GLASS WINDOW
INT. CORRIDOR PO LIN TEMPLE- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The largest of Hong Kong's outlying islands... Rural villages. Not much evidence of the twentieth century except televis Dominated by a mountain at it's center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand meters high. Remote. Isolated. A road winds up through clouds to an ancient Buddhist mon the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls lined with traditional Buddhist paintings and s Thousands of candles illuminate an enormous image of the A gray robed MONK moves through the room lighting more ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appears  in   the  doorway. Suit, tie, overcoat, scarf. He removes his shoes. Enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the front of the shrine. Lights a joss stick, places it on the altar... Tums and walks to the back of the room. Sits down next to a MAN -- Similarly dressed, same age. Chinese. Carries a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you follow the eight fold path?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Jeff the briefcase -- 4/6/92 D.G., %W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  used  to  come here  when, I  was very  young. My Father  brought  me.  He  thought it  was a  place of perfect tranquility...Do you believe in God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)                                        Everyone believes in God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are atheists --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They believe in luck. It's the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff snaps open the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick layer of sealed packets containing fresh Swiss ba Two 9mm WALTHERS. A photograph of a middle aged CHINESE MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to count it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff doesn't. Closes the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very bad man -- Nobody will ever miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slow, sad, distinctly Chinese song. The musical accompaniment is Western. Blues guitar. Keyboards. The voice is a woman's. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: As he walks through the temple --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff comes out the huge doors. Looks off at the city of Hong Kong across the harbor -- A million lights. Beautiful, cooly remote...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look in his eyes -- A moment of contemplation -- Tinged with regret? He turns and moves off as THE SONG continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heart of Hong Kong's night life -- A massive NEON EXPLOSION of bars, restaurants, shops, coc Five star luxe class hotels the size of airline terminals Nightclubs with lavish floor shows -- Chic discos -- every possible kind of restaurant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a side street off Nathan road -- A small private club. Rolls', Daimlers, Mercedes parked in front -- An elegant building with a traditional Chinese facade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expensively decorated with lacquered furniture, Chinese a A few knots of men at tables laden with bottles of liquor Hostesses in Cheong Sams -- All nationalities. Private rooms in back for gambling, opium, deals, sex... Against the wall on a platform performing THE SONG; A three piece group with a Woman Singer. She is JENNY KWAN. Late twenties. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark suit, top coat, silk scarf -- He declines the hat check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks over the room. Sees Jenny for the first time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singing -- For a brief moment their eyes meet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOSTESS approaches Jeff. He follows her through the Main Room past Jenny -- Toward the private cubicles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As JENNY'S SONG ENDS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High stakes PAI KAO. The MAN IN THE BRIEFCASE PHOTO, and three others at the t Big time CHINESE GANGSTERS. And they look it. Tough, cruel, very ugly. BODYGUARDS stand around lean against the walls fill the d No noise except the SLAPPING of the tiles on the table as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hostess speaks quietly to Jeff - indicates down the h then leaves. Jeff moves down the corridor, eyes the doorways Stops near the fourth door... He leans up against the wall outside the room. Pulls on a pair of thin white gloves. Brings one of the WALTHERS up out of his coat -- Knocks lightly on the door. A BODYGUARD cautiously opens the door. And the FIREFIGHT BEGINS -- Jeff FIRES TWO SHOTS into his stomach. Then drives into him, forcing the door open -- Rolls into the room... 4/6/92 D.G., %W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lands on his back, now with a pistol in each hand -- BLOWS AWAY the two GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN THE PHOTO
dialogues.text: Reaches for his gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately on his feet with his arms extended in each di at each end. He looks down the barrel of the pistol in his right hand. It's trained on the Man In The Photo. Without looking he SHOOTS a GUARD drawing a gun behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gun half drawn -- Staring at the barrel of Jeff s gun pointed at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesitates... Then BLASTS a hole in the man's forehead. FIRES three more in his chest with the other gun. Wheels around and BLOWS AWAY a THUG who has come through him. The SOUND of a SHOTGUN PUMP -- Jeff leaps to his right as the SHOTGUN FIRES. He avoids the full impact of the BLAST -- Takes some PELLETS in his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARTENDER pumps the shotgun for a second BLAST -- Jeff moves toward him CONTINUOUSLY FIRING both pistols. Every bullet rips into the Bartender's body. His second pellet blast FIRES uselessly into the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of ammunition and targets... He drops both pistols -- Starts for the door. 4/6/92 D.G., O'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An already WOUNDED THUG finds life -- Goes for the BARTENDER'S SHOTGUN... --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff sees one of the Thug's PISTOLS on the card table -- He steps on the edge of the table, catapulting the revolv hand! Aims and FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: JERKING and TWISTING as the slugs TEAR into him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns and walks to the doorway. Hears a SOUND. He raises the pistol to fire, stops when he sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway. She freezes. Jeff s gun pointed at her head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the gun on her. A BULLET SPLINTERS the door jamb beside his head. She jumps out of the way. Jeff BLASTS a THUG in the distance behind her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny runs down the corridor back toward the main room of Jeff gaining on her from behind -- He Tackles her just as ANOTHER THUG FIRES a blast -- Intended for him -- It would have hit her... From the floor Jeff BLASTS the THUG before he can fire ag Jenny struggles to get up -- ANOTHER THUG with a gun appears en the other side of her. Jeff shoots across Jenny's face -- 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUZZLE FLASH of the gun firing -- An inch in front of her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Killed instantly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny SCREAMING... Thrashing around, violently, blindly -- Blood pouring from her eyes. Jeff tries to hold her down -- She struggles away from him -- Never stops SCREAMING. Jeff holds her down, bandages her eyes with his silk scar She SCREAMS, SCREAMS, SCREAMS again... He holds on to her -- then lets go -- moves off -- Face contorted in grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The face of the Buddha fills the screen... Serene, immutable. Jeffs SCREAM echoes o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stripped to the waist. Lying on his stomach -- He SCREAMS AGAIN in agony...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Jeff, Sidney works with a forceps -- Pulling a slug out of his back. Clunk. Drops the pellet in a bowl held by a GRAY-ROBED NUN with It isn't the only slug in the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took her to the Royal Hong Kong. Straight to Emergency. I know a woman who works there. We         can find out how she's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already talked to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She says her condition doesn't seem very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands remove the gauze bandages covering her eyes. The area around them is black and bruised, scabbed. She tries to focus -- Panic begins when she realizes she can't see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the impact from the bullet exploding out of the       gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...may have damaged the optic --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I be blind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, faces the doctor, a nurse -- And hovering not too far away...SERGEANT CHANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light. Shapes. Everything's blurred. Nothing's            clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may only be temporary. It depends on the               amount of damage to the optic nerve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I be blind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way to tell right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny begins to quietly weep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sergeant Chang from the police. Did you see the       man who did this to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face changes as she remembers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you describe him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jenny remembers him. Jeff standing full front -- Both hands hang at his sides... He raises the hand with a PISTOL. Levels it straight at CAMERA. FIRES. A WASH OF BLOOD seeps across the screen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers her face with her hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blitz of NEON. Bars and clubs. Wanchai is the older decaying sister of the Tsimshatsui D A little worn under the garish make-up.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY SINGS O.S.
dialogues.text: The same SONG from earlier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small bar with a few simple wooden tables. Indifferent decor. 4/6/92 D.G.. M/.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny accompanies herself on an electric keyboard. Wears dark glasses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits alone at a table. Nursing a drink. Watching her -- As the K)NG continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 747 bumps down on the tarmac. Taxis to the terminal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang and a UNIFORMED COP wait by the passport control de The Uniform directs Chang's attention to A BLACK MAN in a Chang approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, are you F.B.I. Agent Lee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Hong Kong. I hope you will have a            productive visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I look forward to getting acquainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your first visit to Hong Kong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. My first time here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My superiors are looking forward to meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be my pleasure, I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This completes the official bullshit. They look at one another. Smile. 4/6/92 D.G.. V/.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The space still feels grandly colonial. Overhead fans. Parquet floors. ROGERS sits behind his desk, examining Lee's credentials. English, middle aged. Uniformed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been asked to give you all the help I can. I'm afraid that will be very little. We have rather a lot of our own problems just at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the picture is wanted on Federal charges in the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to a PHOTOGRAPH in the dossier in front of Roge Rogers picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: A candid shot of Jeff in a restaurant --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE
dialogues.text: Rogers drops the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I told you on the telephone, neither his name nor his picture shows up on our computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our sources say that he's living in Hong Kong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rogers is reading the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's charged with "depriving a citizen of his civil rights"..? You'll pardon me, but this seems a rather trivial offense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He deprived this citizen of his civil rights by putting seven bullets in his head and body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm told there are hundreds of murders a day in your country. What's so special about this one to take you so far out of your jurisdiction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This particular citizen was a politician. Corrupt, Mafia connected, a drug trafficker, but a politician. So the Bureau does not want to appear unenthusiastic in the pursuit of his killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll pardon my own lack of enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We also believe he is a contract killer with at least twenty-five notches on his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perfunctory)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad number. You'll find killers for hire are rather common in Hong Kong...Of course we'll help you in any way we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try not to be a burden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please remember you have neither authority nor jurisdiction here, which means if you do find him, you will inform us and we will decide what action, if any, is to be taken. You are not to apprehend him in any way yourself. Do you understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll have your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't carry it on social occasions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not carry a gun on any occasion in the Colony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't dream of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This actually gets a smile from Rogers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you're here, there is something you could do for us. If you'd like..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope ii doesn't involve carrying a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rogers is already speaking into intercom. 4/6/92 D.G.. W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask Sergeant Chang to come in, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another night. Jenny sings ANOTHER SONG. There is an oversized brandy snifter on top of her keyboa Across the way Jeff stands at the bar, watching her. He finishes his drink. Approaches Jenny. Jeff puts a wad of bills in the snifter -- Lingers a moment. She feels his presence. Turns her dead eyes in his direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a request?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I only speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wish a request?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't answer. Moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the other clubs on the street are already closed. Others are closing. Jeff comes out of the Pale Flower. Lights a cigarette. Moves off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is packing up to leave. She takes the money from the snifter. Puts it in her purse. A WAITER tries to help her to the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, I can manage by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a ride home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cab stand at the end of the street. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I'll walk with you..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'll be all right by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows the way out. No need for the white cane she carries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny  comes   out  of   the  nightclub. Turns  left  and  starts up  the street. Now she needs the cane --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her a MOTORCYCLE comes slowly up the street. TWO RIDERS. They trail her for a moment. Speed up -- The passenger GRABS Jenny's bag. Knocks her over. The Driver accelerates... Gets about ten feet. Jeff suddenly appears out of the sha A FLYING KICK sends Driver and Passenger sprawling. The motorcycle CRASHES into a flower stand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pounces on the Kid with Jenny's bag Grabs the bag as the Driver runs off. Jeff indicates the other Kid should follow him -- He does. And fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On her hands and knees groping for her cane -- Jeff comes over to her. Tries to help her up -- She thinks it's one of the muggers -- Wrenches free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds her cane and swings it at him. He catches it. Then grabs her hands. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I m trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops struggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Is this my bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. A couple of guys on a motorcycle tried to take it. They're gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over now. Can I take you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, but you've done enough for me already --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starts to move off. He falls into step next to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, maybe you can reward me by letting me take       you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in the club. You spoke to me, left me         money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come a lot to hear you sing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his arm. They move down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From New York. It's almost the same thing. My          name is Jeff.                                          4/6/92 D.G.. W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak no Cantonese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty or thirty words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you don't understand the songs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably better that way. Here's the car.

dialogues.speaker: A BMW 850.
dialogues.text: He opens the door and helps her into the car. It's difficult for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate being so helpless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He adjusts the safety belt around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it. I'll never get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he closes the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is simple and spare. A piano. Sophisticated sound system. Jeff opens the door and turns on a LIGHT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to have a look around? Just to be       safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Coming home alone still scares me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got rid of him. I feel sorry enough for myself. I       didn't need any more help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks around the apartment. Stops near a high table. Looks at some photographs of Jenny -- Winning a talent contest. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing tennis. An album cover. It's painful for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure that's the way he felt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the way I felt... Would you like something to       drink? I think I have some brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to keep you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be. Please have a drink. I'll have one too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has moved to a cabinet and is fumbling among the bott

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be better. At least you'll know what you're getting. I'm still not too good at fumbling in the       dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't see at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see light. Shapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's poured two snifters of cognac. Gives her one. Jenny lifts the glass to toast him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)                                 'Brighter days ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there anything that can be done? An operation      or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The optic nerve is damaged. They say it might        heal by itself, but it might not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the nearby coat rack Jeff sees his scarf -- From the night of the shooting. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood stained. He touches it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you like to sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking at the scarf, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloodstains are yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who did this to me used it to bandage me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you keep it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep momentos of all the big events in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff doesn't have much to say to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I'm so bitter, but I can't stop myself --      I should be brave and cheerful. Positive and op-        timistic. But, I don't feel any of that. Maybe I will sometime, but not now. I'm blind and depressed and      bad tempered. Good company, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was never crazy about brave and cheerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen my face in six months. I wonder if I've lost my looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you feeling sorry for me or taking advantage of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her. She accepts the kiss. Seems to enjoy it. Then suddenly pulls back... 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands. So does he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sing every night in a bar. You can see me there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves to the door. Looks back and smiles. Realizes it's a smile she'll never see. Turns and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white Daimler rolling along a quiet, narrow street --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang drives. Lee practices shoving a speed loader into a .357 Magnum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect. Eddy'll never make you for a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I look like a police officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like a local cop anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your man Eddy is a pretty bad boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just bad. Insane. And no problem pulling the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Tell me about him. Make me hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the local front man for the Chinese military.       They've supplied guns to every terrorist organization you can think of. Sikhs, Tamils, Khmer Rouge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who do I represent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unspecified. You're just a businessman. If

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: something~ goes wrong, don't give it a second            thought. Shoot first and ask questions later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to go wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shell of a fifty story skyscraper. Deserted for the night. A VAN is parked on the street in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackened rear windows. TWO MEN visible. Smoking cigarettes as they wait. The Daimler pulls up. The van turns on its HEADLIGHTS. Lee and Chang get out of Daimler. EDDY and a THUG get out of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy. sorry we're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the customer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Lee say hello to Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy and Tony shake hands. Eddy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quick burst of Cantonese from Eddy to his companion. -- Evidently a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?                                         4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy's name is Li. Eddy says maybe he's our cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More likely my brother. My old man got around pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang translates. Everybody but Li laughs. Quick, nervous laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang opens the briefcase. Shows it to Eddy. Lined with MONEY. He takes a packet out -- Tosses it to Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's see the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy POUNDS on the hood of the van. The rear door opens. TWO HENCHMEN get out. Both carrying suitcases -- They put them on the ground. Open them. Assault rifles, automatic weapons, pistols... Lots of guns. Lee goes over to examine them. Picks up a hand gun. Puts it through a quick inspection: trigger action magazi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning NOISE from Li -- The Henchmen quickly pack up the bags. A TRAFFIC COP on a MOTORCYCLE pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just a little reunion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the suitcases?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies underwear.  The spring line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a look.

dialogues.speaker: 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.
dialogues.text: Chang takes out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, do we really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open 'em up. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy bends to open the suitcase. Suddenly turns. Pulls a PISTOL out of his waist band -- BLASTS the cop! Chang SHOUTS at him -- Eddy turns the gun on Chang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?! A set up?! You trying to set me up?! You a cop?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks the gun right up Chang's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?! You know me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know you from shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy's friends have their guns out. Two cover Lee. The  other levels  down on  Chang --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut this shit out and let's do business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Here's how this deal is going to work. I take the money~ keep the guns, and kill you. How does        that sound~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he's got the last words out -- Lee KICKS the legs out from one Thug, Throws the other one into Eddy -- Dives to the ground. The Thug covering Chang SHOOTS at Lee. Misses. Chang draws and BLASTS him. Lee rolls and comes up, gun in hand -- BLASTING. One Thug takes a bullet sandwich while firing at Lee -- Chang jumps on Eddy.... Thug #3 SHOOTS Chang in the leg, then BLAM! BLAM! 4/6/92 D.G., %W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes two bullets from Lee. The big slugs death-dance him backward. Eddy takes off running -- Lee checks on Chang, moving quickly to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right! Get him! Kill that fucker! Kill him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee takes off after Eddy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running down the street. Hears FOOTSTEPS Turns. Lee chasing him. Gaining on him. Eddy FIRES a wild shot. He turns a corner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full stride -- Races around the same comer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars, people, lights. Eddy twenty yards away. Kneeling in the firing position. Aims, FIRES. Lee hits the pavement. Eddy FIRES again. Then runs into a crowded intersection -- Lee chases...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More TRAFFIC. Cars, buses, trucks, pedestrians -- Lee runs into the intersection. No sign of Eddy. Hundreds of Chinese faces. But only one black man with a gun... People scatter out of his way -- He sees...

dialogues.speaker: EDDY
dialogues.text: Boarding a CROWDED STREETCAR -- 4/6/92 D.G., %W.H.                                  24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs toward the streetcar --                             People cutting him a wide swath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It moves off down the track.                            Eddy looks out the window.                              Sees Lee running toward the streetcar.                  He'll never make it.                                    Eddy sits down next to A MIDDLE-AGED COUPLE.            Safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streetcar pulling away from him.                    He turns on the speed.                                  Chases down the track.                                  Running like hell.                                      Catches it. Jumps on the back platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee comes into the car.                                 Gun out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified people trying to get out of his way.          He sights Eddy now cringing behind a WOMAN.              Reaching for his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raises his gun.                                         Takes careful aim.                                      People SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabs the Woman as a shield with one hand.              Raises the gun with the other.                          4/6/92 D.G., ~W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet SLAMS Eddie in the head. He drops the gun and the Woman. Blown backward on to a seat -- The Woman falls to the floor -- Her body constricts. Shock. Convulsions. Coronary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee makes sure Eddy's dead. Immediately begins giving the woman CPR. Pounds on her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathes into her mouth and nose. People standing around frozen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me! Goddammit! Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a WOMAN kneels to aid him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rogers, Chang and Lee. Several suited POLICE COMMISSIONERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should be deported and shipped out on the next        plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was on special assignment at my request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have enough cowboys and kung fu killers         of our own? You have to turn some trigger happy           American G-man loose on the streets with a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in the line of duty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a crowded bus. With a woman directly in his line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy had just killed a cop, shot two innocent bystanders -- More innocent lives were in danger so I shot him. You think I should have waited for him to shoot me? Maybe a few more civilians?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman died of a heart attack. You might as well have shot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment. He shot one of the  most vicious criminals in the Colony. That the woman died is regrettable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regrettable ..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tragic, if you like, but not due to any irresponsibility or dereliction on his part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should never have been on the street with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my decision. And I will take full responsibility for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. There's nothing else for the Commissioner to say. Rogers knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he ought to get a medal for killing the son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, Chang and Rogers leave the conference room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a stand up guy. Thanks. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean a word of it. I think you're a fucking menace to public safety --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to get your business done and get the hell out of Hong Kong before there's any more carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me find my man and I'm outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Chang you are to assist Mr. Lee in any way you can that does not involve the slaughter of innocent civilians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny at the piano bar singing. Jeff comes through the entrance. Walks to a table. Passes Jenny. She seems to sense his presence. He takes a seat at the piano bar. Close to her. She's aware of him. Knows it's him. She sings to him. The song finishes. A moment... Wen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know it was me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just knew. Maybe now that I've lost my sight, my other senses are getting stronger. I've heard that's supposed to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do that in martial arts training. Blindfold you and make you use your other senses...I saw a lot of Kung Fu movies when I was a kid. o/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Jenny walk through the crowded NEON wilderness.-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night you asked me if I felt sorry for you...I do. I feel terrible about what happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, looks at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already had enough sympathy. I know. You said that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm sorry about the way I talked last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to apologize for feeling sorry for yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was. Stupid, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to get back at the one who did it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to make him blind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he feels guilty. He tried to help me. After it happened...He didn't do it on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, you forgive him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't forgive him...I don't really want to talk about this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to pull away -- he takes her arm, holds her in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one. I'm the one who did it. I shot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you tell me this? Why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came back because I felt guilty. I'm telling you because I want you. I want to be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $he walks away from him -- then stops...After a moment, J her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have stayed with me last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? It would have been easy. I would have let you. I was at the end of my resistance. Should I be afraid? Maybe you're going to kill me?. I'm the only witness who saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the police. I won't stop you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel much. At all. Ever. I'm trained not to. But...I don't know. I had to tell you. I couldn't deceive you. No matter...what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All day today, I remembered. I was hoping to see you. I thought maybe you'd come to the bar, but then I didn't know. (sighs)                                              I'm talking to you like I've already slept with you. You know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already changed my life more than any man I've ever met...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Jenny are making love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you make love, do you close your eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  always  did.  But  when you  can't  open  them. It's not the same. Anyway, I can't  really explain  it yet. It's my first  time, you  know. I  mean my  first time since...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of bed, moves to a cabinet. Pours two glasses of wine from an open bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was you before you told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you know me in the dark? My smell. My          presence...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that really true? (Hai ma?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. (Hai ya).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He returns to the bed, hands her a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you went with me anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you need to know about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to know more about me. I'm a killer. I         don't know how to explain it. I'm good at it. I get paid well. I decide who I'm going to kill. It's w%at I do. It's all I've ever done. Kill people. But I still think of myself as a good man. And I want to be         with you. Now. Tomorrow. Next week. Next                month. Next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in love with me. Yes? But you have to be in      love with me to justify hurting someone innocent --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But its' good. I'll have you forever. You have      to live a long time. For me. You owe it to me.           4/6/92 D.G., %W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A compressed vista of cars, pedestrians, taxis, signs, fl The teeming city going about its mid-day bustle. Sidney, carrying a BROWN LEATHER BRIEFCASE, moves through Hops on a groaning, crowded streetcar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney picking his way through the densely packed vehicle crowded boulevard. He stops and grabs a strap next to a MAN READING A NEWSPA Sets his briefcase down -- Next to a similar BRIEFCASE OF BLACK LEATHER at the Man's The Man reading the newspaper pays no attention to Sidney The exit bell RINGS -- Many passengers begin to disembark. The Man with the newspaper reaches down, grabs Sidney's s exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watches the man with the newspaper disappear from view th streetcar again lurches forward. Reaches down and picks up the black suitcase. Finds a seat. Puts the suitcase across his lap. Drums his fingers on it for a moment. Then lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modem. Glorious view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands on his terrace. Middle floor. Looks out on the harbor. SOUND of a BUZZER. He Tums and goes back into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparsely furnished. Some antiques. Khmer Buddhas. Burmese wall hangings. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tibetan carpets. Chinese paintings. Jeff walks through the apartment to the front door. Opens it. Sidney comes in. Carries the BLACK BRIEFCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The briefcase. I guess somebody's got a big         problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff walks into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Want a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff appears in the kitchen doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the action hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throws a can of beer at Sidney. Sidney drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his right hand, looks at the frozen fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't use it, you lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff picks up the can. Opens it. Puts it in Sidney's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it the hand or the nerve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff indicates the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what you' got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: 4/6/92 D.G. .. W.H.
dialogues.text: Sidney opens the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disassembled rifle. A hand gun. A photograph. A smiling, middle aged Chinese man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Weng...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was your boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did he. That's why my boss wants him dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's your boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better you don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I don't want to know...If I do this for you, Sidney, we're clear forever. I don't owe you anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't owe me this. You don't owe me anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. I should do it for free. As a service to humanity. This guy's a scumbag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be easy. He's got heavy protection around all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my last job. I'll do it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a gun. Gives it a quick inspection... 4/6/92 D.G., V'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ir must be a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The singer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)                                  Yeah...It's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sights down the barrel of the gun. Then looks at it in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy to pick up. Hard to put down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and Jeff lie naked on the bed. Jenny is studying Jeff s face with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you must be very handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go away for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me about it. I don't want to know. I'm       happy now. That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a job. I can't say no to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do it. It's the last of that life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do anything. Except be good to          rne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do this. I have a friend. A man. He was my teacher. He saved my life twice. If I do this for him, I'm free of him. I won't owe him anything else. I'll be gone for a couple of days. Then we'll get out of here. Go live somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a passport -- There's nothing here I can't leave in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure you don't hate me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, anyway. I'm too much in love now. Maybe later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Chang looking through files -- Shirt-sleeves... Ties loosened... They've been at this for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding a dossier)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks like my man. 'Killed a local Mr. Big and six heavies. Walks in a nightclub by himself. A gun in each pocket. Blows away the target and whoever else gets in his way and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on that case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a whole bunch of eyewitnesses here...Male, Caucasian, medium height, medium build... That's the best they could do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I questioned most of them myself. Mainly gang types. Nobody saw anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this girl he blinded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I questioned her. She was in shock. Couldn't remember what happened. 4/6/92 D.G.. V'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody talk to her lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? She can't go through the mug books -- or your photo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can talk. Let's get her in. Put her with an artist and let her draw us a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang doesn't think much of this idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else you got to do? I'm telling you this is my       man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have lots to do. Especially today. Unlike you. I'm      not on holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were on holiday. Isn't today a holiday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, today... Today is a holiday, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What holiday is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuan Yang, The Dragon Boat Festival. Spectators line the docks. BOATS of every description dot the Harbor. Filled with spectators. The course is surrounded by HUNDREDS OF JUNKS. Decorated with team colors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE CANOE with a Dragons head carved a'. the bow. Tail at the stem. Forty or fifty rowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BIG DRUM in the middle. A drummer who times the strokes. Eight boats row into position for the start.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOCK
dialogues.text: Chang & Lee sit in a POLICE LAUNCH watching. 4/6/92 D.G.. ii'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dragon boat races commemorates the death of Chu Yuan in 288 B.C. An honest minister of state... The last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention all competitors. Please report to the floating platform for the opening ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This years honorary chairman is a respected local businessman who is also the Colony s biggest drug trafficker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY WENG surrounded by police makes his way across the d platform floating at water level. He smiles and waves to the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you're people are taking good care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police protection for this scum! His private army's bigger than the police force!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dots the eye of the dragon and the race starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind a lar~e yacht -- A powerful speedboat appears. Jeff at the wheel. He takes out a pair of huge binoculars... Focuses on the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the binoculars -- Tony glad hands the crowd... Walks down on to the floating platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puts down the binoculars -- Takes the scarf from around his neck... 4/6/92 D.G.. ii'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dragon boat races commemorates the death of Chu Yuan in 288 B.C. An honest minister of state... The last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention all competitors. Please report to the floating platform for the opening ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This years honorary chairman is a respected local businessman who is also the Colony s biggest drug trafficker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY WENG surrounded by police makes his way across the d platform floating at water level. He smiles and waves to the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you're people are taking good care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police protection for this scum! His private army's bigger than the police force!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dots the eye of the dragon and the race starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind a lar~e yacht -- A powerful speedboat appears. Jeff at the wheel. He takes out a pair of huge binoculars... Focuses on the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the binoculars -- Tony glad hands the crowd... Walks down on to the floating platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puts down the binoculars -- Takes the scarf from around his neck... 4/6/92 D.G., V,'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wraps it around his left hand. Pulls the rifle out of its cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats have gathered at the starting line. Tony Weng arrives. The Dragon's Head is presented to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulders the rifle. Peers through the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sight passes through the crowd and settles on -- Tony Weng... As a flag obscures him --

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Lowers the rifle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tray of paints brought to him. He traces the brush... Daubs it in the red paint --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for the signal to start. The DRUMMER is poised...

dialogues.speaker: STARTER
dialogues.text: On the platform the starter raises the starting pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paints a red spot in the left eye of the dragon. Then the right eye. Cheers. 4/6/92 D.G.. V'.H.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER
dialogues.text: Pounding for all he's worth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clasps his hands over his head -- The victory gesture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raises the rifle to his shoulder. FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face in the CROSSHAIRS. The bullet makes a small hole in his forehead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rowers furiously churning water -- Drums pounding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People on the platform gather around Weng's body... PLAINCLOTHES COPS looking around for the direction of the shot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanning the boats with his binoculars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds Jeff. As he drops the rifle into the water --

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Lee shouts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee races down the dock for a boat. Chang follows.

dialogues.speaker: PLATFORM
dialogues.text: A COP talking into a walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came from the direction of the fishing boats. Seal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: off the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump into a boat -- Chang starts the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rowers paddling furiously -- Cutting off Lee & Chang s boat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watches the police milling around. Sees:

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: His boat trying to maneuver behind the dragon boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decides it's time to leave. He puts the boat in  gear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving slowly away from the FISHING JUNKS. Turning away from the harbor... Out into the bay -- 4/6/92 D.G.. W'.H.                                  41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loaded with COPS --                                       Prowls the harbor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuts in front of the Police Launch.                      Chang gesturing wildly for them to follow.               They don't seem to pay much attention.                   The boat quickly ZIG ZAGS between two big yachts --       Heads out toward the bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff comes out into open water.                          Lee and Chang in hot pursuit.                            Gaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks behind him.                                     Sees the follow boat...                                  Jeff cranks up the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff s boat kicks into high speed.                       Engine SCREAMING.                                        Pails away from Lee Bc Chang --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang pushes the throttle to top speed.                  It's not enough.                                         They're losing him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffs boat swings around behind a small island.          Vanishes from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come around the island.                             No sign of Jeff...                                       4/6/92 D.G.. O'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call for some back up. He's got to be around here someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't got a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do I know? It's not my boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got to be around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat passes another island. There are a lot of islands in this bay --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff s boat heads into a small cove. A few fishing boats. A ramshackle landing. Fishermen's huts on the beach. Laundry hanging out to dry. Nets. Kids playing in the water. Woods behind the beach. Jeffs BMW hidden in the trees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff ties the boat up to the landing. Walks up toward the beach --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years old. Playing in the sand. Smiles. Waves at Jeff --

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Waves back... 4/6/92 D.G., li'. I-I.                                  4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunmen. Camouflaged in the trees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rifle. Telescopic sight. He raises it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff in the CROSSHAIRS. He leans down to talk to the Little Girl -- Suddenly obscured by hanging laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowers the rifle. Looks O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning against a shack. Gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Jeff s car. Another gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouched talking to the Little Girl. She gestures toward the woods. He looks in the direction she's pointed... Suddenly, he gets up and quickly moves away from her --

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dives Hits the ground -- 4/6/92 D.G., V,'.l-l.                         44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun drawn

dialogues.speaker: FIRING.
dialogues.text: BULLETS PUNCHING the sand all around him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot.                                             Killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his feet --                                     Spins.                                            SHOOTING at the Gunman behind the shack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs from behind the flimsy building --

dialogues.speaker: FIRING.
dialogues.text: Drums of GASOLINE nearby --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the sand...                            EXPLOSIONS all around her.                       Crying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting at the running Gunman --                  Hits him.                                         Hits the gasoline.                                The shack EXPLODES in a fireball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the cove.                                 They see the explosion.                           Chang turns the boat.                             Heads into the cove, full throttle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff running into the laundry lines --             BLASTING as he goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood spurts on one of the sheets --               A Gunman shrouds himself as he falls...           4/6/92 D.G.,W.H.               45.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Speed reloads --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Gunman run out of the woods.      Jeff spins and BLASTS.

dialogues.speaker: THE LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Runs toward Je ff --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powers into the cove.                 Rides up onto the beach --             Chang and Lee jump out --              Chang has a gun.                      Lee doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running to Jeff --                    A Gunman's bullet hits her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs for the little girl --            Covers her with hfs body.             FIRING in every direction...

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Bullets rip into him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks her up.                      Runs for the car.                     FIRES at Chang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang starts to shoot back.           Can't.                                He'll hit the Girl.                   4/6/92 D.G.. V,'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee grabs a pistol off a dead Gunman -- Quickly goes on the run after Jeff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff gets to the BMW. BLOWING AWAY the last Gunman -- He's in the car and off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHANG k LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing across the beach. Head to the road -- In time to catch the BMW's exhaust as it disappears from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL CAR coming in the other direction -- Chang and Lee stop it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never catch him in this thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a hospital around here -- anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacred Heart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll take the girl there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eject the driver -- Jump in. Take off in Jeff s direction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Little Girl crying -- Bleeding... He unwraps the scarf from around his wrist. Cushions her head with it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff s car roars up to the entrance -- 4/6/92 D.G., O'.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff runs down the corridor carrying the little girl. She's stopped crying -- Lost consciousness... NUNS, NURSES, INTERNS swarm around him... Directing him to the emergency room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff slams through the double doors of the emergency room A DOCTOR indicates a bed. Jeff lays her down -- The EMERGENCY TEAM begins work immediately --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxygen. Check her blood pressure.  prepare her for surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff holds her hand -- The NURSE tries to push him away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to be all right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take good care of her,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang and Lee pull up. Jump out of the car -- They see Jeff"s BMW... Lee s call was on the money. They rush into the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A curtain is drawn around the bed. The Little Girl is being prepped for surgery -- Oxygen mask over her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood pressure's low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's lost a lot of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse is dropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiting room is crowded with PEOPLE -- Patients waiting to be admitted. Friends, relatives. Nurses. A uniformed hospital SECURITY COP. Chang and Lee burst into the room -- Guns drawn -- Chang holds his badge out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man came through carrying a child..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They went to emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points Lee heads for the door... Chang SHOUTS instructions to the Security Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call headquarters for backup! Don't let anyone leave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follows Lee through the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty beds. Ten on each side. Each one partitioned by a curtain. A corridor down the middle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Operating Team working on the Little Girl... Jeff watches anxiously -- The Nun begins asking him questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you related to the patient?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is Chinese. Jeff clearly isn't. Suspicion in the Nun's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! You can't go! I have to          register your name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff has disappeared behind the curtain -- The Nun follows him...

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The Nun comes out into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir...Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of Jeff. Lee suddenly appears -- Coming through the doors behind her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nun is now suspicious of everything, everyone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see your badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang appears behind Lee, badge in hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police! He's with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee is already moving down the line of curtains --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the nearest curtained partition. Lee WHIPS OPEN the curtain -- In the classic firing position. Chang behind him -- 4/6/92 D.G.. W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just an empty bed. No sign of Jeff --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee immediately moves on to the next partition. Also empty. He motions for Chang to watch the exit. Moves on to the next partition. Whips back the curtain... Firing position

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Operating~ Team freezes -- Nurses SCREAM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from the police! Just go on about              your business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee spins around. His gun pointed directly at Chang -- Jeff SUDDENLY APPEARS right behind Chang! His gun at Chang's head -- Nothing Lee can"do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lee)                                Put the gun on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Fine. Say goodbye to your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee puts the gun on the floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are wanted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk! Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee kicks the gun away -- Jeff takes Chang's gun. The Operating Team continues to work on the Little Girl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Chang do what he says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff watches the Doctor work on the Little Girl.      A pistol in each hand --                               One for Lee.                                          One for Chang.

dialogues.speaker: THE LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Shows some sign of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her pulse is rising,             (a beat)                She'.s breathing on her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look up --                                             See that Jeff is gone.                                They spring to their feet --                           Run to the corridor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang and Lee race through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major turmoil --                                       People shrieking and screaming --                      Lee & Chang run in...                                 Jeff is not to be seen.                                Chang speaks to the hospital SECURITY COP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee & Chang fight their way through the crowd -- Find an exit on the other side of the room. They look out the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He vaults a railing -- Runs to the parking lot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee & Chang run out of the hospital -- The BMW sits there. Jeff has left in their car. And... They've lost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rogers, Chang, Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your man, as you call him, is now wanted for murder by us which means that your official duties here are finished. We may want you back as a witness in a trial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you've got to arrest him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will  remind you  that he  is wanted  on a  prior charg in  the U.S.,  and we  will apply  for extradition  if yo catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't sit too well with Rogers. It wasn't intended to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extradition is the province of our respective governments. Not for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suspect may be an American citizen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until my job's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you implying we are incapable of handling this ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just like to help out -- see this thing through to th finish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are likely to be some politically sensitive aspects to this case of which you are unlikely to be aware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll work under the investigating officer and merely offer my assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang will be in charge. I will leave this up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pregnant moment, then Chang smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need all the help I can get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand you will have no official status. You will be an adviser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chang)                                  I'll want daily reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: .INT. CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: As they leave Rogers' office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I get to keep my gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffs picture pasted up on the wall. Lee and Chang going over files...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who got hit in the nightclub six months ago was Weng's number two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee studies the dossier

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number two what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Five Flowers Tong. Crime syndicate. Prostitution, gambling, drugs, guns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So our man's an outside hired gun. Who's the new number one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. We'll have to wait and see. Probably a power struggle. Maybe our man will tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's assume he did them both. I say we start with the singer. Jenny Kwan. He risked his life for the little girl. He's sentimental. Probably a major marshmallow for this woman he blinded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may be soft on blind girls and kids, but he's got to be smart enough to get out of town. There were people trying to kill him out there today. I doubt they're just going to give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Or maybe he's going to stick around. Solve his own problem -- I got a feeling for this guy. I think he s pissed off that he was crossed on the beach. And I don't think he just stiffs the blind girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a guy. You sure you want to catch him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. He has to go. The man's a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big view of Repulse Bay. 4/6/92 D.G.. W.H. An empty livingroom -- The phone RINGING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have left town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff hangs up the phone. Drags on a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the Chinese servants. It is England here. In fact... More England than England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large, florid man of Anglo stock. Middle forties. Athletic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowler runs  up. Bowls. Payne makes a towering out. Tea is called

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne walks over to a table. Towels off. He is intercepted by Sidney --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never thought of you as a cricket man, Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4/6/92 D.G.. ss'.H. Sidney has no time for small talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me you wanted Jeff dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit at a table as far from everyone else as possible A SERVANT arrives with tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you have tea, Sidney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be Mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne pours tea for himself and Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I have told you? Would you have killed him for me, if I had told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But I would have counseled you against it. I still counsel you against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't that I don't value your counsel, Sidney, but you have conflicting loyalties in this matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only want what is best for this house and for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Jeff dead. This house wants Jeff dead. Is that enough for you? Or do you want me to explain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only ask that you allow me to plead for him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then  you  do  want  an  explanation. We  police have seen  him.  They  will now  begin to  look for  him. If they catch him he could expose me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know it's you. If you pay him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is connected to you. You are connected to me.         Kill him, or kill yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discussion is over. Payne suddenly switches to Cantonese --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been the gun in the hand of this house for a
