dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: long time. First for my father and now for me. Now that Weng and Lim are out of the way you stand to be the new number one. But I just be absolutely sure of your loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the gun in your hand. You aim. I fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting, waiting. A  cigarette  in  one hand. Pistol in the other -- JENNY'S      SONG     o.s..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny at the keyboard... As the SONG finishes. Lee sits down at the piano bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty song...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reacts to the American accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I thought you were a friend. I don't see very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sing beautifully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your friend an American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he coming in? I'd like to meet a countryman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Would you excuse me, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up. Moves off. Chang sits down next to Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's seeing him. I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Elvis is dead and Jenny Kwan is       seeing Jeff -- Can we get a twenty four hour a day      surveillance and a wire tap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surveillance. Yes. I don't know about the wire         unless you've got evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No evidence. Just instinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to get it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't moved. Jenny's song is still playing on the tape. The doorbell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff crosses the room to the door. Fast. Rips open the door...sticks he pistol up under Sidney's c Sidney stands frozen while Jeff frisks hon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I trust you, Sidney. You're my friend. My        teacher. You taught me the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes Sidney into the. apartment. Gun at the back of his head. 4/6/92 D.G.. 9,'.l-l.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still playing by the rules, Sidney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that at the beach the day before yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes Sidney into a chair. Sits down across the coffee table from him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I f I knew I wouldn't tell you.                     (shrugs)                                 The rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sold me out. What do the rules say about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you believe it, you have to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did they know I'd be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put your car there. They could have followed me.      It wouldn't have been hard. I wasn't looking for        anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just careless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have any reason to be careful. I didn't know they wanted you dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they want me dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't want any link between them and the hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know who they are. The only link            between them and the jobs I did is you. Why don't       they kill you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm them now. I work for them. They have my             loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where does that leave me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still your friend. You take your money and you disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H ii ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney puts the briefcase on the table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff puts his gun down on the table. Reaches for the briefcase. Sidney quickly picks up the gun. Points it between Jeff s eyes. A beat. Jeff opens the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This strikes Jeff as being very funny. Sidney's not kidding. He pulls the trigger. An empty CLICK. Jeff opens his other hand. Lets the bullets fall on the floor. His other hand pulls another gun out of his waistband -- Points it at Sidney's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring these guys with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff WHACKS Sidney across the head with the gun. Tums and FIRES into the plate glass window behind him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullets SHATTER the glass leading to the balcony. Rip into the body of MAN WITH A GUN -- 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a new CLIP out of his coat pocket. Jams it into his AUTO. Nails a GUY coming through the front door. Then leans round the wall corner... FIRES three shots -- A BODY FALLS across the doorway... Jeff picks up Sidney by the collar. Hauls him to his feet. Gun at his head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You 're my friend, but I owe them. I swore it twenty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the rules. These people trust you less than I      do. Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tai Pan of the Five Flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hired me to kill Weng and Lim? They were his          guys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had other ideas. They were not loyal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the Tai Pan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make any difference if you tell me, because you're already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me who it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon Payne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The head of the Five Flowers is English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the opium  days. The  Mainland wants  the legit side to stay in Hong Kong until  they take  over. They Give him a free hand on the other side. So he killed Weng and Lim --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lowers the auto. Walks away from Sidney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did what I would have done. You owe them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you. I'll get you your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm giving you your life in payment for what I owe      you. We re even now. I never want to see you            again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FORENSIC COPS sift through the wreckage. Examine the bodies. Dust for prints. Look for shell casings. Chang is talking to a UNIFORMED COP. He breaks off and crosses to Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as forensics concerned nobody's ever lived in this apartment except these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Referring to the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your instinct?                                          4/6/92 D.G., W.H..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No prints. No clothes. No personal effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You show his picture to the neighbors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's ever seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private  elevator  from the  garage. Even  the maid's never seen him. The place is rented  to an  off shore company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has this been dusted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wis" is the stereo system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course. We are very meticulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee presses the on button. There's a tape in the deck. It's JENNY'S SONG. Lee looks at Chang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee sits down in Jeffs chair. Listens to the SONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff on a portable phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She answers the RINGING PHONE -- Next to her bed. She's in it. 4/6/92 D.G.. O'.l-l.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was so good. Want me to tell you about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ls something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing a new life won't solve. Are you ready to       travel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay that way. I'll be back for you sometime soon. This is all the notice you're going to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time. I'll be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surveillance team listening to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Sergeant Chang. Right away..

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: He stares out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang throws sacks of garbage down the stairs -- He is accosted by an angry OLD WOMAN, who pops out of a d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you supposed to be the new janitor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of way is that to do your job? Does this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: look like a trash bin to you? It's a fire escape.  Look there's trash everywhere. What if there's a fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang retreats under this barrage. Starts to collect the garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I can just fly over it? You pick that up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: right now.  And take it out to the bin where it  belongs.  I pay my maintenance fee every month...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he carries out the garbage -- Jeff slips by him up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lets himself into Jenny's apartment. She looks up at him as he comes in. As if she could see him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are cops everywhere. They're using me as bait. Stay away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff jumps back from the doorway. His PISTOL out and raised. Lee's gun is pointed at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff's gun is pointed at Lee's head. 4/6/92 D.G.. Q'.l I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move into the apartment -- Each with his gun on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I couldn't warn you before. They came       right after you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.                                   (to Lee)                                    You don't look like a Hong Kong cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look much like a Tong hatchet man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a gun on me. I've got one on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got plenty of time. I'm not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald Lee. FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little off your turf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I'm assigned to you. Wherever you are      is my turf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own personal FBI agent. What'd I do to get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astamendi is the one we've got you for. There are      others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny, why don't you make us some tea. Mr. Lee         and I could be here awhile...How do you figure me      for that job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've barely got a case on me for a politician so crooked his partners offed him for being too greedy. You're going to let the creep who paid walk. And now you're standing here willing to die rather than let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And we don't get paid much either. What have you got on the creep? Maybe we can deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're willing to die to bust me on suspicion of killing some creep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your job, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody could doubt Lee's seriousness. Jenny SCREAMS! Runs in front of Lee -- Jeff's out the door. Lee FIRES. Too late. Lee breaks past Jenny -- Knocks her down... Stops to pick her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hit him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's out the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee runs down the corridor -- Chang coming at him from the elevator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here. You take downstairs. I'll take the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee climbs out the window to the FIRE ESCAPE -- Chang runs off downstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff races up the fire escape to the roof -- 4/6/92 D.G.. v,'.t-t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee comes out on the roof -- Laundry lines.... A pigeon coop. A shed which houses the air conditioning unit. But no sign of Jeff.. Lee cautiously moves through the hanging laundry... Takes a quick look in the shed. Nobody there. He moves quickly around the corner. And runs straight into a flock of suddenly loosed hysteri Finally free of'"the birds -- He races to the edge of the building -- Leans over -- Pistol ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure on the pipes... Climbing the side of the building --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Chang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot. It's me. He's right behind me with his gun pointed up my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff on the ground, level... Steps out from behind Chang, into Lee's sightline Pistol pointed straight up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much Lee can do.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Jeff disappears under a parking shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang is on the phone talking in Cantonese. Lee talks to Jenny. 4/6/92 D.G.. W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he's the one who shot you. Made you              blind..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that changes how I feel about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a professional killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: II' I kill somebody it's because I have to and in defense of the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Innocent people don't get hurt in defense of the law?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her point is made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's like you. He kills bad people too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there are a lot of very bad people looking to kill him right now. I figure I may be his only ticket out of here alive. But I need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  won't help  you put  him in  prison. I'm  sure he'd rather be dead...If I could  get my  sight back  but it would mean losing him -- I'd rather be blind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think he feels that way about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he doesn't. Then he could be far away from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney in the outer office. The large carved doors open -- Payne appears. Surrounded by four cheap suited VIETNAMESE THUGS... 4/6/92 D.G., v,.ti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, this is a surprise. We've been looking for you everywhere. And now here you are large as life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I f ailed to kill Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did your men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should keep your word and pay Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me keep my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne is on his way out of the office. A couple of the Thugs precede him into the elevator. Sidney and the others follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ! don't understand why you are still alive, Sidney. The others who tried to kill Jeff are all dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spared me because we are friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though you betrayed him and tried to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a very good friend indeed. We should all have       friends like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney doesn't disagree --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs, Payne and Sidney come out of the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can be a dangerous enemy. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arc you suggesting he might be dangerous to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he wants to do is go away. Pay him and let him      leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's somebody from the American FBI           here looking for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if. they catch him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff knows the rules. He'll never talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a chance I'm unwilling to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is the car?                                (to Sidney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've decided to use his money as payment to the           person who brings me his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ask you not to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it pleases you, I will beg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney gets on his knees. Payne looks around. Snaps his fingers. The Bodyguards drag Sidney to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've served this family well for two generations. I promised my father you would always be taken care         of. But you are beginning to become a problem. Don't push your luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Princess Daimler pulls up. A Thug  opens the  door for  Payne -- Suddenly: Jeff jumps off the floor of the car -- 4/6/92 D.G., 9'.I [.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLASTS one Thug Grabs Payne. Gun to his head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Di op the guns! Drop them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four remaining Thugs have in fact drawn guns -- They drop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney. You drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney moves around to the driver's side. Pulls the driver out Gets in. Jeff pulls Payne into the back of the car. The car steams up the ramp, out of the garage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney drives. Jeff holds the gun on Payne --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a loyalty check, Sidney. Which side are you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the same side as the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough for Jeff.. He turns to Payne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to kill  me you  have to  send somebody better than me. And there's nobody better  than me. That's why you hired me in the first place. So do I kill you or do you pay me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay you, of course. I don't know how long          you II live after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not smart to threaten a man with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-low do you want the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like the agreement. Give it to Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be able to get cash till the bank opens        tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just keep you with me until then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my word of honor you will get the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your word stinks and you have no honor. That's why we're all here in this car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were seen at the Weng hit. The police are             looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It becomes mine if they catch you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I know the rules even if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the rules. I'm good for the money. I'll pay you..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right. I don't think I could stand being with you for the next eight hours. Sometime after midnight, I'd get bored looking at your pretty face. I'~l have to do something about it. (to Sidney)                                l ct me out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney pulls over to let him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in touch. Don't fuck with me about the money. Twenty four hours. Or your dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out the door and gone. Disappearing into the street throng

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Il' I asked you to shoot him, would you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. After you've paid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come get the money tomorrow night.. Then we'll see.. So far the big loser in all this is you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, Chang, Rogers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have shot him, but I felt it would endanger the civilian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commissioner will find this a welcome change From your previous policy. This civilian is the girl he blinded in the Lim hit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They acknowledge this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now she's his girlfriend. It's a novel approach to courtship. I assume she's still under surveillance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty four hours a day. Phone tapped and we've lifted her passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guess is your man is long gone by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: l le's not going to leave without the girl. He said so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're prepared to rely on his word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll l pardon my cynicism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: \Ve really don't have anything else to go on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll show up for the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we have nothing to do, but wait, I suppose we'll wait..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't wait too long. Rumor on the street says       there's a big price on our man's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's offering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five Flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that Weng and Lim are dead, who's boss of            Five Flowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unclear.. Rumor says it's the mainland who ordered       the hits and it's being run from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys who ordered the hits are offering the reward for the killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way they can deny responsibility for the deaths of their brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee looks incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice way to do business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Hong Kong, Mr. Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Sidney. They stare out at the lights of the city through the huge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't fail her. I've brought her too much that's bad already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff pours himself a small whisky. Another for Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's because I'm guilty. And she forgives me.      She doesn't want anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands Sidney a glass.. 4/6/92 D.G. .. W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I can't fail her. I have to stay alive for her. At least for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to make a deal with Payne, but you may have give up the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather die than let Payne not pay me...Why can't I give up everything for her. Including my pride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have killed you Sidney. But you're the only friend I have. And I need your help;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sings. PLAIN-CLOTHES COPS everywhere -- Sidney at the piano bar..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song finishes... Sidney a"approaches.~ -- speaks to Jenny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plain-clothes cop watching them as he speaks into a pay phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney arrives in a car. Jenny comes out with a small bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked across the way ... Chang talking on a pocket phone -- Chang and Lee are eating noodles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just pulled up in his car -- yes we see her -- right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hangs up. They watch as Jenny get into Sidney's car. 4/6/92 D.G. . ~1'.I,'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's car leaves. Chang starts the car. They begin to follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney's car makes a turn. Chang and Lee's car follows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's going to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far does she think she's going to get without her passport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better put the airport guys on alert, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee picks up the microphone to call in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney's car makes another turn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following Jenny's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not going to the airport. That's where you turn... Maybe we should pull them over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's going to meet our man -- They're not trying to lose us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the perimeter of the walled City. Rows of dilapidated buildings. Shops, illegal dentists.. Between buildings are dark stairways leading downward -- Jenny's car appears Chang's car follows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Walled City. This is where she's going. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place belongs to China, not Hong Kong. We

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: have no jurisdiction in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean 'we'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way -- You don't want to go in there -- It's free zone for every thief, killer, drug addict in the Colony. And there's no law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A narrow passage. Stairs leading down into gloom. Sidney and six thugs stand in front. Jenny s car arrives. Sidney helps her out.. They disappear down into the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of their car. Approach the alley. Lee starts down the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.. We don't go any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. We'll lose her. I'm going in. Jurisdiction doesn't mean shit to me. I haven't got any anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's  lost.  If you  don't know  your way  around in there, you'll never get out. It's a rabbit warren in there. With very ugly rabbits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee has started down the stairs, Chang follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. If we go down in there we won't live half an hour. I'm not kidding. It's open season on cops in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee's at the bottom of' the steps. Narrow byways lead in several directions. Like an obstacle course in a Fun House. Stoned out junkies. Serious looking hard guys. No trace of Jenny or Sidney. Lee begins to see Chang's point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There''s no place they can go. All we have to do is wait them out. We have informers inside. They'll find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they do I'm going in. With or without you. I lived through the South Bronx, I can live through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, narrow, filthy. stone streets. Houses made of stone, Thugs in front of Sidney and Jenny lead them through the Thugs behind them. Protection. Human dregs littered everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens. Jeff takes Jenny in his arms. As the door closes behind them -- 4/6/92 D.G.. 1'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to be with you. This is the best I could do. For now anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately they're kissing, Clutching, Grabbing, Touching, Tearing at clothes. Sidney's still there. They don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not really safe here. One hour. Two at the most...I'll meet you as soon as I've got the money. Everything else is arranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't hear him. Sidney leaves. Closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rogers, Chang, and Lee.. Going over a map of the walled city --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can cover almost all of it but there's no real guarantee that they can't get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No word on where they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Our informants are working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know why we're bothering -- if there really is a price on him he won't last the night in there.. We can't get to him in there but the Five Flowers can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Peking Opera. It is an indoor/outdoor theater -- Constructed for the Opera's current tour. 4/6/92 D.G. W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People milling around Stands outside sell food....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opera has already started. Brilliantly painted scenery Heavily made up actor singers. Elaborate headdresses. Percussion instruments on one side of the stage. Wind instruments on the other. Lead ACTOR-SINGER in the middle. Shrill but intensely disciplined vocal performance.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Payne sits in front. One of his retainers approaches him -- Whispers something . Payne leaves his guests Moves through the audience to the back. The audience eats Talks among themselves . Normal behavior in Chinese Opera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back of the theater framed in the doorway is PAUL An assassin for hire Payne approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Yao I have need of your services. Let's discuss some details...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affability is  wasted on  Paul -- They walk out on the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rising tide of percussion Accompanies a storm at sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Jenny in bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have another hour -- then we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If everything goes right... Thailand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Thailand. Temples. Elephants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you like boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be on one for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police have my passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one of the things that has to go right. Sidney's getting you a new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear a SOUND. Jeff reaches across Jenny for his gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly -- Lee bangs open the door... Gun out. Jeff freezes -- Mid-reach for his own pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your clothes on and let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have any authority here, cop-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got all the authority I need, right here in my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny has pulled the sheet up over her. 4/6/9'2 D.G. W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figure you're going to march me through the streets in handcuffs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can find your way out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got friends outside. Now cut the shit and let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly  Jenny has picked  up  Jeff's gun. She stands. Points it vaguely in Lee's direction. A blind naked girl with a gun in  her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Jenny, put the gun down! I don't want to shoot you but Goddamn it, I will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down,  Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless he leaves us alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee has moved out of Jenny's line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.  Or, I'll shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun suddenly goes off Deafening BLAST. Kicks out of her hand. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to...It went off accidentally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee picks up Jeff's gun Jeff is helping Jenny to get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang bursts in. Sees that Lee has everything under control...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have  to move! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunshot. People come here -- maybe five flowers -- they're going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't want that. Spoil all the preparations        we're making for you back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang leads the way out of the small house. Jeff and Jenny follow covered at the rear by Lee --

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE WAY- DIRTY GLASS WINDOW
dialogues.text: Paul Yau watching...

dialogues.speaker: YAU'S HANDS
dialogues.text: He snicks a clip into a 9mm pistol, then checks the clip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang still leads the group along --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Yau moves quietly along -- then quickly scrambles do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes alert... He looks back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About two more blocks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if we stop for a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Not so funny. This is a very bad place...through here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A filthy, rat infested area with a back door -- Jeff, Jenny, Lee, Chang come in -- Chang moves straight through to the back door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group makes its way out into the very narrow streets. They round a corner. Suddenly Chang goes down in a HAIL OF BULLETS -- Paul Yau BLASTING with both hands -- Jeff pulls Jenny back behind a building. Lee comes forward with his pistol. FIRES four times Yao is HIT, falls back out of sight. Lee quickly bends over Chang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee looks up -- Jeff holding Chang's pistol directly at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Too bad he didn't. This was a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to do something about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man kills your partner, you're supposed to do something about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man kills my partner, I like doing something about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wounded  him.   He   won't   make   it   very   far. you and me have a truce and go kill the son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get out of here alive, we'll talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay here -- you'll be okay. Five minutes. No        more. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jeff And Lee are gone ---

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ALLEY
dialogues.text: Jeff tracking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's leaking  pretty good...over here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two pros on the hunt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...across there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see the blood trail lead to a doorway in a three sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: being KICKED in -- Jeff and Lee enter, guns extended -- Two old Chinese men eating at  a low table. No one else. They look up in fear Lee moves to the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move upward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paper lamps give a dim illumination -- thin walls -- Several doors on either side of the hall -- Lee takes one side Jeff the other 4/6/92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each begin kicking the doors open --

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: Prostitutes and their TRICKS suddenly come running out, s armed men -- All of them half-dressed, shouting,  swearing --

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: standing back to back in the corridor amid the sudden ang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is suddenly silent... One could hear the proverbial pin drop -- And something does. Plop. Again... Plop. Jeff and Lee look down at the floor   blood... Both simultaneously turn their guns upward and begin BLAS Paul Yau in the open rafters BLASTINGback But he is cut to ribbons by their slugs Yao falls, crashing down at Jeff's and Lee's feet -- very A long silent moment. Jeff and Lee find each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He levels down at Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You're my prisoner. You're out of bullets. I've got two left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try, but you're the one that's bull shittin',

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff now levels down on Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try your luck. I'll give you a free one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee pulls the trigger. Click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, I've got two left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because I'm out of gas doesn't mean you're         not...

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: Jeff whistles a bullet by his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one left. And you're my prisoner. Or you're       dead. Which is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't be too hard for you. You're a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It won't be hard at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to say thank you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, Jenny, and Lee come out of another alley. On to the lighted, active street. An old, beat up car is parked there. Covered with dust. Looks like it hasn't been driven in weeks. Jeff pulls a golf bag full of guns out of the trunk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are the cops? They're supposed to be watching the exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never one around when you need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tosses Lee the keys -- They get into the car. Jeff reaches into the golf bag, SNICKS a fresh clip into Lee starts it and they pull away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee drives. Jeff and Jenny in the back. Jenny rests her head on Jeff s shoulder. Something causes her to raise back up -- She touches her cheek 4/6/92 D.G., W.H. There's blood on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is blood, isn't it? Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is bleeding through his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took one in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny starts to pull off Jeff s coat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right. I just need to get it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better get you to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just drive. I'll tell you where to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff still has the gun -- She again touches his shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're losing blood. We have to do something,        Bandage you or something. I don't know anything      about this and I can't see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lee)                                How's your field emergency medical technique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top of my class. And she's right we'd better do      something about your shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls off the highway onto a small road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights of the car illuminate Jeff, Jenny and Lee. They sit at the edge of the water -- Lee slits open Jeff s bloodstained shirt. A slug embedded in his arm just below the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me everything you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just cut open his shirt. I'm looking at the wound. It looks uglier than it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep telling me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm going to sear the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lighting a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you afraid you'll get cancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should live so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee is cutting open a shotgun shell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get you something to bite on so you don't        break your teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means it's going to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like living hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny has a scarf in her purse. They twist it to give it bulk. Jeff gives the cigarette to Jenny -- Bites down on the scarf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1"m stanching the wound with gunpowder. Stop the       bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours gunpowder from the shell into the wound. Takes the cigarette from Jenny. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights the gunpowder. A FLARE as the gunpowder ignites -- Jeff convulses from the pain. Lee struggles to hold his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff can't speak. Nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far so good. Now for the really dangerous part. You got to wash it off with water from this river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff moves off to the river to wash his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're some cop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to keep him alive so he can be brought to justice back home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause to let the irony sink in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: f m just doing my job, what's your excuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it -- this guy blinds you in the middle of committing a crime -- then you just take him into your bed. Fall in love with him. Life goes on, forgive and forget, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't really explain it to myself. How could I explain it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you know he was the one who blinded you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before or after l went to bed with him. That's what you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to answer. I'm just curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't I tell you. After.

dialogues.speaker: 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.
dialogues.text: A slight chuckle from Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking. And you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slight, not so demure chuckle from Jenny as Jeff return

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You both seem to be having a pretty good time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just discussing the power of love -- how's       your arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurts like hell, but it's better. Thanks -Which then brings us to the big question of what to do with        you..Jenny and I have appointments to keep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically you're my prisoner so I figure to go with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, we're traveling alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might need some help before you're out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you offering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I accept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lee)                                What about arresting him? You just said he was a         prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well work that part out later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car winds up the road to the monastery. Pulls up into the courtyard. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Po Lin Monastery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out of the car. A MONK comes down the stairs to greet them. He takes Jenny's hand and leads her up the stairs. Jeff takes a leather duffel bag out of the back of the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How safe are we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swell. I hope there are a lot of guns in that bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff shakes the bag. Clanking metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb the stairs into the monastery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several generations of MacGregors have inhabited this off Anglo-Chinese decor. Antiques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney appears in the doorway. Ushered n by two thugs. More thugs inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to fuck around anymore Sidney. Either you tell me where Jeff is and keep your position in this house, or you eat shit and die. What's it going to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you break your word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to thugs)                                   Take his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to frisk Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep my word. He'll get the money. I just want to be there when he gets it. Now tell me where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thug reaches inside Sidney's coat to take his gun. Sidney reaches inside the thugs coat. Comes up with the thugs gun first --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLASTS him and the thug nearest him. Payne leaps out of his chair swings his swaggerstick at S Knocks the gun out of it. Then slashes Sidney across the face the body. Then the face again. Then the body. Frenzied -- Furious -- Sidney's face a bleeding mass of flesh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks him in the ribs. Motions to the thugs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prop him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two thugs swiftly lift Sidney to his feet. Stand him up in front of Payne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you think I am that you can tell me what to do? Did T suddenly get to be so weak? Have I lost so much respect that you dare question my         orders? You are a fucking flea, Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We owe him the money. You gave your word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another slash across the face with the swagger stick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father lifted you out of the stinking pile of shit you came from. And I took the gun out of your hand, put a tie around your neck. 'Gave you position,        authority and my trust. You repay me with insolence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the tai pan. You must keep your word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's for you to decide? Do you think I'm         weak, Sidney? That I'm not the man my father was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father always kept his word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I keep mine. You're going to tell me where Jeff       is. I promise you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes a case from a drawer in his desk. Opens it. Takes out a cleaver. Ornate handle. Very sharp blade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Jenny follow a MONK down a corridor to a cell. The Monk pulls open the heavy door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cot. A small shrine. Candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get some sleep. I'll come get you when it's           time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just getting me out of the way in case something happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going to happen. You'll need your sleep.        It's a long trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wraps her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to wait for Sidney. You'll be safe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If all I wanted was to be safe, I wouldn't be with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From now on maybe you'll have both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back when it's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne cuts off Sidney's tie. Slits open his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a very different man than my father Sidney. He        never liked to get involved in this side of our           business. I prefer not just to be involved but to be 'hands on' as the Americans say. I don't mind getting my hands dirty or bloody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gout of blood spatters on Payne. He makes the first cuts in Sidney's stomach --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to tell me now, or do I keep cutting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney seems to pass out. The guards struggle to hold on to him. His dead weight sinks to the floor. Suddenly Sidney hurls himself backward knocking both guar Sidney lands on them Rolls. Grabs a gun off the body of a dead thug. Blasts both guards --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throws the cleaver at Sidney. Then goes for a gun in the drawer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodges the cleaver. Leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney grabs Payne by the hair. Gun at his tempIe. The shots have brought other 'thugs. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the fucking money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there. In the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a brown briefcase sitting undisturbed on the des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you've got any bullets left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's not my gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks the gun in MacGregor's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a chance. Let's find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney cocks the hammer back. Gurgled sounds of fear and protest from Payne --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: l                                              SIDNEY Open it. I want to see the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney takes the gun out of MacGregor's mouth. He opens the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: l  INT. GREAT HALL-PO LIN MONASTERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lee pass the shrines of Bodhisattvas, various Ch Decorated with burning incense flower offerings. Candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think your friend'll show up with the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the same friend who sold you out before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's's why I'm sure hell show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same friend who sold you out to the same people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust him.

dialogues.speaker: I LEE
dialogues.text: I never trusted anybody that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney was my teacher. To tell you any more would involve telling you about a lot of crimes you don't need to know about.

dialogues.speaker: I LEE
dialogues.text: So you know Ill come after you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lawman, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have shot me when you had the chance.

dialogues.speaker: I JEFF
dialogues.text: How could I shoot anybody with a heart as good as yours? What I should have done was let that thug kill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: I JEFF
dialogues.text: I told you. Your heart's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the thug? He's just a guy with a shitty job. Maybe he had a good heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No heart. Just a lot of demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Training. Instinct. How do you know anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you figure it's all right for you to just kind of weed those bad hearted guys out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: l                                       JEFF I never said it was all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever kill anyone with a good heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not lately anyway. Before I met Sidney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it. Sidney changed you. From an animal to a         killer with nice table manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney taught me the rules. My table manners could        still use a little work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to lay all that 'honor among thieves' bullshit on me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were is honor among people. Some people.                  Thieves, killers, even Iawmen. It's why I trust you.      'Why you trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you know me pretty well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty well Your heart sticks out a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure saving my life buys you six months. Then I'm on your case again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'They'll never let you back on my case after tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months far free.  For saving  my life  and because I'd like to see this poor misguided girl get  what she thinks she wants --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you could too, but you've got too many debts       to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only debt I've got is to Jenny -- She's even made me care about my own life -- now I really want to stay alive -- I've never been scared before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I thought you're a tough guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be. But maybe I lost my nerve because of a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be the first one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens. Sidney and Payne get out. Payne carries the briefcase. Sidney still holds the gun on Payne. He's bleeding badly. Weak. Getting weaker. Three thugs come running up out of the bowels of the gara Guns drawn. Sidney shouts at them in Cantonese. They don't understand. They're Vietnamese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell these assholes to do what I say or I'll shoot you right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to thugs)                                         Do what he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the elevator! Do it now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'They hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can shoot you in the foot if I have to prove I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what he says! Get in the fucking elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start for the elevator. Sidney takes one of their guns. Puts it in his pocket. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A button is pushed the doors close. Sidney then BLASTS the button -- He hustles Payne over to his car. Sidney takes the briefcase. Throws it in the back. Sidney gets behind the wheel. Leaves Payne standing on the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a dead man, Sidney,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff told you. It's not smart to threaten a man with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney FIRES! Hits Payne in the chest -- He drops to the pavement. Sidney fires again to make sure. It clicks empty. Sidney throws the gun at prostrate, unconscious Payne. Puts the car in gear. Roars off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney wounded bleeding, and furious. Hurtles through the garage -- Bashes through the exit banner and out onto the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne lying on the pavement. In a pool of his own blood. He pulls himself up. Thugs arrive from the stairs. Swarm around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, are you all right? You've been shot? etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind me. Get after him. Kill that son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne has enough strength to bellow like a wounded bull It costs him. He has to be helped to his feet. The thugs race for cars which appear immediately. Payne is helped into one. They roar off in pursuit. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney's car on the road up the hill to the monastery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney in bad shape -- Struggling to stay conscious. He rounds a corner. The Po Lin Temple comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some distance behind Sidney. The headlights of Payne's cars bore up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lee sit in the same place. Sidney and Jeff sat at the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens to Jenny if you don't make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be taken care of. I've arranged all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swiss lawyers, offshore banks... Numbered               accounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're so rich, how come you're hanging around       here for this money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always get paid. And Sidney needs to restore his      honor by paying me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him restore it by Western Union. Deposit it in      your account. Anything...get out of here while you      CAN.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: reacts to the giant front doors crashing open -- 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appears in the entrance. SIumps to his knees. Both arms wrapped around the brief case. He flings it on the floor. He still wears a jacket. His tie is cut off. Sidney shirt is slit open. He bleeds from the cuts in his stomach. From the blows to his face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff goes to him. Kneels. Embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry it was so long in coming...l"m nothing now. An outcast. I want to die. I want to die. Help me. I'm already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spectator. Until he hears the cars arriving outside. Moves to the entrance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney has rolled  over on  his back. Jeff holds his head up off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the presence of a cop -- In the house of the Buddha -- A hard decision for Jeff.... He takes out his gun. Puts it at Sidney s throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing the doors. As the first headlight beams illuminate the entrance. He turns back to Jeff. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break out the guns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back, BOOM! Sees Jeff kill Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that in front of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't come into this...                  (snaps his fingers)                  ...that much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee is already at the gun bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors burst open. Two thugs firing automatic weapons just to announce their They shatter sacred, precious crockery -- But hit nobody. Jeff turns and shoots both of them. Exhausting all the bullets in his clip. He takes off his tie. Improvises a tourniquet for his arm. A ferocity in the gesture. A declaration of war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULLS an AK47 from the bag. He takes out the next round of thugs trying the entrance. He tosses Jeff an Uzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an army out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as we can hold the entrance. The numbers       don't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take up positions at the entrance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne bandaged, c g an automatic -- Leading his troops. Then is a large number of them. And more cars coming. He motions for them to spread out. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)                                  Find another entrance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thugs spread out in all directions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee notes the change in strategy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other entrances?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably twenty -- Grab the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff takes off. Lee grabs the bag. Follows. A barrage of bullets to cover their retreat. They run through the hall. Out the back. Into a courtyard. Surprise thugs coming the other way. Quickly blown away... But the noise attracts others --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lee run through the courtyard. Through an open doorway. Thugs follow a moment later --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under heavy renovation. Scaffolding all over the place. Images removed. Only one way in. Only one way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They barricade themselves behind shrouded pews... Begin blowing away thugs trying to storm the entrance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're going to run out of ammunition before they run out of guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're o.k. in here for the moment. Except Tor the birds. There are a lot of birds in here. Songbirds in cages. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screeching and twittering. White doves left free. Wings clipped, Hysterically trying to fly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sitting up listening to the gunfire. The door opens, a Monk enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monk identifies himself in Cantonese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's doing the shooting? Is it the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's gangsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I   Payne and thugs running through... Grey robed monks begin to appear. Shaved heads. To protect the sacred images. Payne guns down the first Monk in his way. The thugs blast two more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I   A hundred monks roused by the gunfire. An abbot opens the door and shouts at them.

dialogues.speaker: I ABBOT
dialogues.text: The immortals are under attack/ Protect them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He collars a couple of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ring the bells! Call for help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lee holding them off at the entrance. But the room has been breached from the roof. Thugs begin appearing on the scaffolding. Bells are heard ringing o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I                              I swear I'm hearing bells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're calling the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're alive when they get here, you're under       arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You're my hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs up on the scaffolding announce themselves. Bullets hail down. Jeff and Lee run for new cover. Lee takes a bullet in the leg. He crawls under the scaffolding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff fires straight up through the scaffolding... Thugs taking it from below. Jeff runs out of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Throw me a gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee slides two guns across the floor. Reloads himself. Thugs coming in from everywhere. Jeff picks up the guns NAILS two at close range. Takes a hit n the side himself. Jeff falls under the scaffold. He and Lee sit back to back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How good a shot are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top of my class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff takes a ring of shotgun shells out of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the door. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time.                                             4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff throws the ring at the doorway. It lands in front of a cluster of thugs. Lee shoots. Hits one of the shells. Chain reaction. Buckshot explodes in every direction. Thugs blown in every direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff grabs the briefcase. Lee the gun bag. They move out. One covering the front. The other covering the rear. A lot of shooting and blasting. Bells, screeching birds, whirring of wings --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne and a few thugs out hen. Command position in the rear. Payne carrying a submachine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, we better get our before the police       get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll worry about the fucking police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lee come out at the other end of the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the gringo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bust him and find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full on firefight across the courtyard. Jeff and Lee f firing constantly. Payne and thugs returning foe. But the thugs more concerned about getting out. Finally they break and run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They duck into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lee shoot their way past the remaining thugs. Follow Payne into the building. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back of the building. Where Jenny is. Payne and the thug coming down the corridor. The Monk leads Jenny out of the cell into the corridor. The thug recognizes Jenny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Jeff's girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lee  appear at the other end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are about to fire They see Jenny. The Thug takes this opportunity to shoot at them. One shot each from Lee and Jeff takes him. Payne grabs Jenny. The Monk tries to stop him. Gets shot for his efforts. Payne sticks a gun at Jenny's temple --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your guns. We all know how this is                played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny screams. Tries to wrestle free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny. Don't be afraid. I'm right here. Right in       front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your gun and don't take another step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is walking steadily toward him. He has not dropped his gun. He gestures for Lee to wait. Lee doesn't drop his gun either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to see the cops any more than I do. We can both walk out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you shoot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to take another step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's's no reason we can't walk out of here alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want is her and the money. Mere's a back way       out of here, and a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you and I walk out together like old friends. Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the girl and the money. I have no problem with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What guarantee do I have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I play by the rules. My word is good. You ought to       know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? He's a cop and he knows who I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff suddenly SLAMS Lee over the head with his gun. Lee slumps to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We money and the girl. I have no other interest. I       don't care what you do with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's your problem. You want to kill an FBI agent.        You do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you for hire any more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Half a million U. S. Cash up front. You have       a reputation for not paying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him and Ill give you the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit fucking around! If you want to get out of here alive let her go now. He's your problem. Do             what you want with him. But do it fast. There isn't      much time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payne moves the gun from Jenny's head to kill Lee. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that instant... Jeff KILLS HIM with one shot. A long moment -- Then he wraps Jenny in his arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. We're going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee is regaining consciousness. Jeff kneels down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. It was the only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm lucky he didn't have a lot of cash on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think I was going to kill you, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're a pro. You don't work for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months and then you start looking over your           shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take care of her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He embraces Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Lee shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your story might look better to the police if you were UNCONSCIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff suddenly HITS him again over the head with the gun - Lee slumps back to the ground. Jeff takes Jenny by the hand And they walk out the back of the temple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small boat clears the harbor.                      Sails out to sea.                                   Jeff at the tiller.                                 Jenny next to him.                                  Her hair blowing slightly in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main Page Quentin Tarantino Martin Scorsese John Woo Robert Rodriguez

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _uacct = "UA-388614-1"; urchinTracker();
